So this what it feels like ? So this is what the wait for Half Life 3 feels like. 

Half Life 2 Episode Two is the sequel to Episode One and begins straight away. We find ourselves in the outskirts of City 17 as the Citadel has now opened a portal to the Combines home world and it's now up to us to find a way to the rebel base and shut down the portal once and for all.

The gameplay is identical to previous titles in the Half Life 2 games.  Overall there's not much to say here as it's basically DLC to Half Life 2. 

Graphics wise this game looks a tad bit better than Half Life 2 due to the range rendering, which I thought was under used in Half Life 2 Episode One. The portal coming from the citadel can be seen throughout the entire game which looks outstanding.

There is a reason this is my favorite Half Life title and that's the action sequences. This game is like a great action movie. Action scenes after action scenes after action scenes and it all ends up to one of the biggest cliffhanger endings in history of gaming. I'm not joking it actually pains me not knowing what happens next.

I also love the incredible soundtrack. It's beyond kick ass and is one of my favorite game soundtracks of all time.

In the end Half Life 2 Episode Two is a thrilling ride and it should be played by everyone. I'm glad I finally joined the bandwagon. Now I can join the Half Life 3 waiting community. 

Final Rating:
10/10 - A must own and a must play

If you liked this review please consider giving it a thumbs up and if you disliked post in the comments what you disliked about the review.

For more reviews follow Snort's Review curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/snortsreviews#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

Half Life 2 Episode 2 is like your absent father. You're really happy to see him, then one day he just vanishes without a word. You ask Mom why, if it's your fault, but she just shakes her head sadly.

Years and years later, you lay awake at night, wondering what you did to make your favorite franchise disappear.

Obra maestra. Continuamos la historia de HL2 Episode 1 con esta magistral segunda parte con un argumento trepidante y con un final de infarto que pide a gritos esa tercera parte que nunca se llegó a materializar.

Nada mas que añadir en su apartado gráfico o sonoro que ya era perfecto para sus anteriores entregas. Si Episode 1 daba una vuelta de tuerca a mecánica de juego con zonas novedosas, Episode 2 coge esa idea y la eleva a un nuevo nivel de una manera paulatina pero siempre creciente.

Nuevos y temibles enemigos, nuevos vehículos con funcionalidades estupendas, nuevas armas y un mapa semiabierto en donde vamos a tener que defender muchas posiciones en una trepidante zona final del juego hacen que sea una de los capítulos mas divertidos que he jugado y además con un nivel de dificultad acorde.

Lo recomiendo totalmente.

Episode Two is shorter than Half-Life 2, but more longer than Episode One when it comes to story mode and gameplay length. It has some changes as well, such as now the flashlight has battery meter (like the original Half-Life) and will not count toward the other meter (the one used for sprinting and underwater). The gameplay is very interesting, and it has its moments where the fight gets interesting. Keep in mind Episode Two follows after Episode One, and Episode One follows where Half-Life 2 left off.

The game gets more and more interesting. Give it a try and you will know what i mean.

The whole Half life series, starting from HF 1 and all the way to this HL2-EP2, is an amazing gaming experience.

It is the classic computer gaming experience for everyone, from those who never played games before to those who spent 1000+ hours in CS:GO/CoD/Minecraft/console games/whatever type of game.

The combat/movement mechanics feel very comfortable and natural with keyboard/mouse controls. 

Gameplay is not too complicated yet it has enough puzzle elements in it to keep people focused.

It's an old series but it is definitely more enjoyable than many games of 2015.

Loved this. At first I was excited because the game was in the open woods, a place half life hasn't explored much, but then the game alludes to more mining levels, a place I've already been in HalfLife 2, so I lost my excitement.... then I got to the mines.

Boy, this game had me jumping left and right, in the game and irl. Huge beasts chasing you, terrifying zombies crawling behind you, giant monsters trying to wreck yo stuff up.

The stroy as well was very, as per usual, amazing. Though it really leaves a lot of answers totally unanswered.

Well worth the playthough, better than episode 1 also imho.

[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Half-Life 2: Episode Two was the last of the weird counting method Valve used to make sure they didn't need to count to three. Half-Life 2: Episode Two was developed by Valve Corporation and released late 2007.


[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] The story picks up, right where Half-Life 2: Episode One left off; Alyx Vance and Gordon Freeman are going to be reunited with Eli Vance and Dr. Kleiner to plan the next step in their battle against the Combine forces.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520577049

[b]Gameplay:[/b] This game returns to the more familiar setting of Half-Life 2, you aren't forced to rely solely on the Gravity gun like in most of Half-Life 2: Episode One. There is a new NPC that you encounter called “Hunters”, these are savage killing machines that are very imposing and at times down right freighting when encountered.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520577103

[b]Achievements:[/b] There are 22 achievements on Half-Life 2: Episode Two. One third of the achievements are unlocked just by playing through the story. The rest are pretty tough and require careful planning, or a very long time running around.
The most noteworthy achievements in this game are: Get Some Grub [i](“Squish every antlion grub in Episode Two” – That took forever.)[/i], and Little Rocket Man [i](requiring you to Carry a Garden Gnome from the beginning of the game to nearly the end)[/i] – I have an obsession with garden gnomes because of this achievement, stay away from the precious!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520577080

[b]Price:[/b] Half-Life 2: Episode Two is priced at $7.99, you're better off purchasing [url=http://store.steampowered.com/sub/469/]The Orange Box[/url] for $19.99, where you will gain all the Half-Life 2 games + Portal 1.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I think Half-Life 2: Episode One, and Half-Life 2: Episode Two, really should have been one amazing game. Separate they're short but sweet. To quickly recap, Story: Excellent. Gameplay: nearly identical to the previous games. Achievements: Getting 100% completed will take longer then Half-Life 2, or Episode One. Price: a bit high, but the orange box is an excellent deal for the whole series.
I recommend this game to anyone who's played Half-Life 2 and Half-Life 2: Episode One. You don't want to jump into this game, you will want to play the previous games first.
Thank you for reading my review!
